header.title: The best Fence installation company in Palo Alto
bullets: For all of your fence projects large or small in Palo Alto, Ergeon is the best choice!
Build a free custom quote online!
Conduct virtual onsite visits to take away unnecessary time and hassle.
Our skilled team of local contractors will be there to give you a masterfully crafted new fence.

Yelp.description: Ergeon replaced a back fence for us. They have great quote building tool, where you can select all the fence type. The price was competitive with other quote, but quality of service and customer care was exceptional - they communicate everything effectively, were super punctual and work was done quickly.
Yelp.name: Roman K.
Yelp.title: They have great quote building tool and the quality of service and customer care was exceptional

Google.description: Ergeon removed an existing 72’ wood fence and replaced with a new one. The fence is well constructed and quite attractive. The cost was very competitive with a number of other bids I received. All of the Ergeon personnel with whom I dealt were professional and friendly. I would strongly recommend hiring Ergeon for any fence construction project.
Google.name: Richard N.
Google.title: I would strongly recommend hiring Ergeon for any fence construction project.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 4 feet, or 6 feet on properties having street frontage on University Avenue, between Middlefield Road and the eastern city limit (see Ordinance for special Regulations on this area)
faq.side-yard: 4 feet within street side setback, 6 feet beyond street side setback, 7 feet interior side yard
faq.corner-lot-rules: 3 feet max height above the adjacent curb grade on 35 feet Visibility Triangle Area measured from the curblines

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
